newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss Notre Dame gunman too depressed to be judged.
newsitem.headline: Swiss Notre Dame gunman too depressed to be judged.

text.p: A deranged Swiss gunman who shot and wounded a priest and a sexton in a church in a rare burst of terror in Geneva was not responsible for his crime because he was severely depressed, a court heard on Tuesday.

The Swiss government has asked for the case of the 53-year-old former lawyer, dubbed "the madman of Notre Dame" by the media, to be dismissed because he was suffering from profound depression at the time, Swiss news agency ATS reported.

The man, whose name has not been released, drew a pistol inside the Notre Dame Roman Catholic Church in downtown Geneva just after evening mass on December 14 and shot a priest and a sexton in the legs.
He surrendered after a six-hour siege by heavily armed police.
ATS said the Geneva court prolonged his detention for two months, but that the prosecutor was unlikely to press charges.
